missing.translation[0].definitions[0].de: something that is missing is not in its usual place, so that you cannot find it
missing.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: We found the missing piece of the jigsaw under the chair.
The keys have been missing for ages.
The scissors have gone missing again.
Two bottles were missing from the drugs cupboard.
missing.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if part of something is missing, it is no longer attached or has been destroyed
missing.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Two of her front teeth were missing.
The last page of the diary was missing.
Thereâ€™s a button missing from your shirt.
missing.translation[0].definitions[2].de: someone who is missing has disappeared, and no one knows if they are alive or dead
missing.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Two crew members survived, but two are still missing.
When Lily did not come home, her parents called the police to report her missing.
Nearly 100,000 young people go missing in Britain each year.
missing.translation[0].definitions[3].de: not present or not included in something
missing.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Why is my name missing from the list?
Something was missing from her life.
